headline: BlackRock details a trade designed to capitalize on a US dollar that will stay historically weak for years
summary: Dollar weakening cycles since the 1970s have lasted an average of eight years, BlackRock says. The current cycle is less than three years old.

headline: Bitcoin Stuck At $110,000 But Institutions Will Drive A Rebound In Q4, Expert Says
summary: Despite recent volatility pushing Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) below $110,000, experts say strong institutional adoption could drive a rebound by year-end. What Happened: Jeff Park, head of ETF strategy at Bitwise Asset Management, said in an interview that $90 billion in institutional treasury company capital, combined with Fed rate cuts and ongoing regulatory tailwinds, will form a structural price floor that could trigger supply squeezes and short-covering rallies. headline: Goldman to Buy $1 Billion of T. Rowe Stock as Firms Team Up
summary: The unusual arrangement means Goldman will use its balance sheet to hold equity in T. Rowe, whose stock has tumbled more than 50% from its 2021 peak.  The companies will collaborate on a range of investments for retirement savers and wealthy investors, they said in an emailed statement.  Goldman will make “a series of open-market purchases” to amass up to 3.5% of T. Rowe’s stock, potentially making the Wall Street bank one of its five biggest shareholders, according to the statement.

Rowe’s stock, potentially making the Wall Street bank one of its five biggest shareholders, according to the statement.

headline: Goldman and T. Rowe ink new partnership as Wall Street hunt for retirement money intensifies
summary: Goldman Sachs is taking up to a $1 billion stake (3.5%) in global asset manager T. Rowe Price with the aim of taking private assets to the masses and US retirees, the Wall Street bank said Thursday.

headline: Citi Hands BlackRock $80B Assets in Wealth Deal
summary: Citigroup is entrusting BlackRock with tens and billions of dollars of clients' investments in a move that will outsource more of its wealth unit's offerings. Citi doesn't have an in-house asset management platform and is now doubling down on the advisory side of its business, reports Bloomberg's Todd Gillespie.

raw.headline: Citi Hands BlackRock $80B Assets in Wealth Deal
raw.summary: Citigroup is entrusting BlackRock with tens and billions of dollars of clients' investments in a move that will outsource more of its wealth unit's offerings. Citi doesn't have an in-house asset management platform and is now doubling down on the advisory side of its business, reports Bloomberg's Todd Gillespie.

headline: BlackRock to run $80 billion for Citi as bank refocuses wealth unit
summary: (Reuters) -BlackRock struck a deal with Citigroup to manage about $80 billion in assets for the bank's wealth management clients, Citi said on Thursday.  Clients currently overseen by Citi Investment Management (CIM) will continue to work with their Citi private bankers for wealth advice, asset allocation and strategy selection.

raw.headline: BlackRock to run $80 billion for Citi as bank refocuses wealth unit

headline: Citi to Deliver New Customized Portfolio Offering Powered by BlackRock to Citi Wealth Clients Globally
summary: NEW YORK, September 04, 2025--Citi Wealth today announced the selection of BlackRock to create a new portfolio offering for its clients – Citi Portfolio Solutions powered by BlackRock. This offering will combine the strategic investment advisory and planning capabilities of the leading global bank with the investment management and technology strengths of one of the world’s preeminent asset managers.

raw.headline: Citi to Deliver New Customized Portfolio Offering Powered by BlackRock to Citi Wealth Clients Globally
raw.summary: NEW YORK, September 04, 2025--Citi Wealth today announced the selection of BlackRock to create a new portfolio offering for its clients – Citi Portfolio Solutions powered by BlackRock. This offering will combine the strategic investment advisory and planning capabilities of the leading global bank with the investment management and technology strengths of one of the world’s preeminent asset managers.

headline: Goldman takes $1 billion stake in T. Rowe to tap retirement money
summary: (Reuters) -Goldman Sachs will invest as much as $1 billion in T. Rowe Price Group and will also partner with the asset manager to offer private market products to retail investors, the companies said on Thursday.  Shares of T. Rowe were up about 6% in morning trade.  Big financial firms such as Goldman, BlackRock and Morgan Stanley are making a big push into alternative assets, an area dominated by private equity firms, to capitalize on their growth potential and attract new clients.

headline: Blackrock Silver Receives 4.24 Million Dollars from Warrant Exercises and Upsizes Eastern Resource Expansion Drill Program at Tonopah West
